sentences.en: But provincialism in educational research is, alas, nothing new.
sentences.cn: 只不过教育研究中的地方主义也实在是屡见不鲜了吧!

sentences.en: He wanted to escape from the provincialism of the small university where he taught.
sentences.cn: 他所执教是一所规模很小的大学,他想摆脱存在于其中的地方主义桎梏.

sentences.en: How did I ever break free from that provincialism imposed by an academic elitist?
sentences.cn: 我怎样才能打破这个学院派精英强加在我身上的这种地方偏见 呢 ?

sentences.en: The word is a provincialism, but has made its way into standard speech.
sentences.cn: 这个字原来是方言, 后来变成标准语言了.

sentences.en: There are two theoretical tendencies of this philosophy provincialism and autonomism.
sentences.cn: 国外生命科学哲学研究有两种主要的理论倾向,一是分支论,一是自主论.

sentences.en: Three cups of Qinghuawu liquor conveys provincialism of all the life.
sentences.cn: 三杯清华婺一世家乡情.

sentences.en: Wright grew frustrated with American provincialism.
sentences.cn: 赖特对美国的地方偏狭观念愈发感到沮丧。

words.tran_cn: 粗野的人；乡下人；外地人
方言；地方风格；乡下习气

trans.tran_cn: 地方主义，地方偏狭观念，地区性
trans.tran_en: Provincialism is the holding of old-fashioned attitudes and opinions, which some people think is typical of people in areas away from the capital city or any large city of a country
